applicability_reasoning: This regulation does not apply to the provided pension scheme rules document for several key reasons: 1) The regulation specifically addresses claim settlement offers made by insurance undertakings to claimants, while this document is a pension scheme rules document that outlines the structure and operation of an executive pension life cover scheme. 2) While the document does mention death benefit claims, it does not contain any procedures or policies about how claim settlement amounts are calculated or offered - it only defines the maximum allowable benefits under Revenue rules. 3) The document is primarily focused on establishing the scheme's structure, trustee duties, and benefit limits rather than claims handling procedures. 4) The claims-related content in the document is limited to basic eligibility verification and does not address settlement offer calculations or procedures. 5) The document indicates that any claims would be handled by AIB Life as the life office, and those procedures would be covered in separate policy documentation, not these scheme rules.
regulation_title: Claim settlement offer to represent best estimate of a claimant's reasonable entitlement
regulation_text: 363. (1) An insurance undertaking shall ensure that any claim settlement offer made to a claimant represents its best estimate of the claimant's reasonable entitlement. (2) In determining that any claim settlement offer made to a claimant is its best estimate of the claimant's reasonable entitlement, an insurance undertaking shall take into account all relevant factors, including the following: (a) any evidence submitted by the claimant, or any third party acting on his or her behalf, to support the value of the claim; (b) any evidence made known to the insurance undertaking by a third party or evidence that should be reasonably available to the insurance undertaking; (c) the procedures used by the insurance undertaking in determining the monetary amount of compensation offered. (3) This Regulation does not apply to a claimant falling within paragraph (b) of the definition of "claimant" where liability is not agreed. 194 [81]
source_name: CENTRAL BANK (SUPERVISION AND ENFORCEMENT) ACT 2013 (SECTION 48) (CONSUMER PROTECTION) REGULATIONS 2025
